definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾爲我的名勞苦，並不乏倦。

sentences.english: He spares no pains to study English.
sentences.chinese: 他不辭勞苦地學習英語。

sentences.english: He was determined to use music to tell the hard life of toiling masses.
sentences.chinese: 他決心用音樂來訴說勞苦大衆的生活的艱辛。

sentences.english: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must undergo the fatigue of supporting it. ( T.
sentences.chinese: 想要收穫自由之果的人，必須承受維護自由的勞苦。

sentences.english: God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight .
sentences.chinese: 但上帝看見我的難處和勞苦，於是就在昨夜責備你。

sentences.english: I will also give him the morning star.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾爲我的名勞苦，並不乏倦。

sentences.english: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
sentences.chinese: 我見神叫世人勞苦，使他們在其中受經練。

sentences.english: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must undergo the fatigue of supporting. (T. Paine)
sentences.chinese: 想收穫自由之果的人，必須承受維護自由的勞苦。

sentences.english: Success comes only with hard work and labor.
sentences.chinese: 唯有辛勤勞苦方有成功。

sentences.english: All have burden could go to Lord, He must rest us.
sentences.chinese: 凡勞苦擔重擔的可以到主那裏，他定使我們得享安息。

sentences.english: This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.
sentences.chinese: 這也是虛空，是極重的勞苦。

sentences.english: Dream toil day and night to run around.
Beethoven's childhood will be very sympathetic to the working class.
sentences.chinese: 貝多芬從小就十分同情勞苦大衆。

sentences.english: Better is a handful with rest, than both hands full with labour, and vexation of mind.
sentences.chinese: 捧一把安逸，勝過兩把勞苦和追風。

sentences.english: Thank you for the trouble you have taken in sending my son to us.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你不辭勞苦把兒子送到我們這二。

sentences.english: He thanked for all the blessings which providence had vouchsafed to him while in this valley of strife and toil .
sentences.chinese: 他感謝上帝在這紛爭與勞苦之谷所賜予他的一切福佑。

definition: to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to surrender and pay allegiance to
